page.title: 14ST. MARKS CHURCH, AMPFIELD
page.content: St. Marks Church is in Ampfield, and it backs onto Ampfield Woods.John Keeble was the {architect }and he thought it would be a good idea to have a church in 1841 for the village people of Knapp.(Ampfield had not yet been developed). The land was given opposite a farm which is now Hilliers 500 yards from Knapp. The{Church}itself is quite small although it can hold 150 people. It is built of chalk and it has a great wooden door. There are lots of rows of pews and the{vicar}sometimes has a choir, which stands at the altar end of the church. At either end of the church there are large beautiful stained glass windows . Standing on the lectern there is a huge bible.
